repository.corpname: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation & Archives

did.abstract: This collection consists of clippings from the United Public Workers (UPW) National Convention, 1948; publications from the UPWA, its predecessor union, and other labor organizations; a copy of the Local #203 United Federal Workers of America Shop Stewards guide book; and newspaper clippings from February and March 1946.

defitem.label: Contact Information:
defitem.item: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives Martin P. Catherwood Library 227 Ives Hall Cornell University Ithaca, NY 14853 (607) 255-3183 kheel_center@cornell.edu http://www.ilr.cornell.edu/library/kheel-center

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection documents the activities of the United Public Workers union.

Of particular note in this collection are the anti-discrimination activities that the union engaged in. Specifically, the union was focused on ending Jim Crow segregation in federal employments in Washignton DC. The campaign to de-segregate the engravers of the Deptment of the Treasury is a major focus of the collection. Also included are the attempts to de-segregate worknin and living conditions for federal workers in the Panama Canal Zone after President Truman's Executive Order 9980, issued on July 26, 1948, mandating fair employment practices in the federal workforce.

Also present are clippings and other materials docuementing the union's response to the rise of anti-communist feelings in the United States and the associated legislation that targeted labor organizations during the rise of McCarthyism in the late 1940s and early 1950s.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: United Federal Workers Records #5653. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.

did.unittitle: Clippings - United Public Workers (UPW-CIO) National Convention

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contains clippings documenting the 1948 convention of the UPW and various actions it took to try and address the rising anti-communist sentiment, especially in the provisions of the Taft-Hartley Act. The clippings are from various newspapers.

did.unittitle: Local 203 United Federal Workers of America Shop Stewards guide book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This folder contians a guide book for shop stewards. This booklet was printed by the union for shop stewards to use for their reference and in the course of taking three training classes to prepare them for their roles. The booklets were individually numbered and ke[t track of by the union. The contents include text for the three classes and five appendices that contain a copy of Local 203's constitution, information on the history of the U.S. civil service, the Hatch Act, the federal wage scale, and post-World War II reconversion efforts.
